feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Year in Resultlookup
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using CY+1 in date filter in MEMBERSET function. Now, I want to bring CY data in date filter in RESULTLOOKUP but it is not allowing me to do. I cannot make date filter to be of single cardinality.

Let me know how to bring whole year in RESULTLOOKUP.

Thanks

entry.title: SAC BW Live: How to Replace “#” (Not Assigned) with Text Like “Missing” Without BW Changes?
entry.content: I am using SAP Analytics Cloud with a BW Live connection.My BW query Q1 joins Q2 and Q3, and Q3 does not contain some dimension members, so SAC shows “#” for those records. This is technically correct, but business users want to see a text like “Missing” instead of “#”.I do not want to change anything in BW queries or master data.Is it possible to replace or map “#” to custom text in SAC for display purposes only? If not, what is the recommended SAC-side workaround?

entry.title: Flexible Time Selection in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content: Is it possible in SAP Analytics Cloud to allow users to select either the current fiscal year or rolling 12 months and also set a From and To range using a date filter in a story?

entry.title: Publication of different bookmarked views in a story in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts, I am trying to use the publication function in SAP Analytics Cloud.

I have a story using several filters like MTD/YTD + Actual/Budget. And I would like to bookmark MTD+Actual/MTD+Budget/YTD+Actual/YTD+Budget as different views and send them to different recipients.

However, it seems that the four views are separated into four files and thus four emails by SAC. I am wondering whether there is a way to consolidate the four views into one file, or four files in one email.

Thank you in advance!

SAP Analytics Cloud, connectivity

entry.title: Disable Open story button for SendNotification API in SAC.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We want to use SendNotification API in SAC to send notification on button click. But we want to disable Open Story button or URL that comes at the bottom of mail. Check attached screenshot for reference. 

Is there a way to disable this button?

entry.title: Mapping multiple employee ID columns to Employee Names for SF model
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on a model in SAC using data from SAP SuccessFactors (WFRequest) via an SF Query.

In the dataset, I have several dimensions that store Employee IDs, such as: (CreatedBy, LastModifiedBy and a few others)

These fields only display the Employee ID, but what I really need is to show the employee name.

I already have a public dimension with employee details (ID, name, etc.). The problem is that this public dimension can only be linked to one of these dimensions . Once it’s used, I can’t reuse it for the other Employee ID fields in the same model.

Any tips or ideas would be really helpful.
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: CAN WE CONVERT STRING TO DATE USING DATA ACTIONS
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a requirement for calculating XIRR within SAC using Data Actions.
When I used year granularity the calculation did work for IRR part. But now, i need to calculate XIRR which needs day granularity. Before converting it to day granularity I want to try with fiscal period with data type as string. but when scoping i was getting error that date parameters cannot accept string, now i want to convert it to date.
How can i achieve it.
Appreciate your help!
Thanks.

entry.title: Can monthly model imports be automated using an Excel file as the data source?
entry.content:
Greetings Community!

I’m looking to automate monthly model imports using an Excel file as the data source. I’d like to know if this is feasible, what the recommended approach is, and any best practices or pitfalls to watch out for.

Goal

  • Schedule a recurring monthly import job that consumes data from a .xlsx file.
  • Ensure the process is reliable, scalable, and low maintenance (ideally no manual intervention beyond updating the Excel file).

Thanks for any insights!

Andrew

entry.title: SAC SSO: Merging existing users without losing content
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

we have IAS configured as a proxy. Users are provisioned from a custom IdP to IAS and then created dynamically in SAC (attribute = User ID) via SSO .

In SAC, there are already manually created users with existing content.
The SSO users and the manually created users in SAC have different User IDs, which is historical.

Our goal is to switch fully to SSO and replace or merge the existing SAC users without losing user content (stories, private objects, settings).

Currently, we face the following issues:

  • SAC does not allow duplicate email addresses when a new SSO user is created (different User ID, but same email address).

  • When we assign roles manually in SAC to an SSO user, they are removed at the next login.

Our questions:

  • What is the recommended approach to dynamically create SSO users in SAC and transfer or replace existing content from the old user to the new SSO user?

  • Is there a simple or supported way to migrate or merge existing SAC users with the new SSO users?

  • How are Owner property handled when SSO is activated, and what should be considered to avoid issues with access or content ownership?

Thank you very much for your help and experience.

Best regards

entry.title: Measure Filtering in SAC with BW Live Data
entry.content: I am using an SAP Analytics Cloud analytic model with BW Live data. Is it possible to filter only one measure like a dimension filter without using BW variables. Is this possible only with value range filtering or also by selecting each unique value.

entry.title: How to Show Previous Year (Same Month) Date in Dynamic Text Using Story Filter in SAP SAC
entry.content:
Hello everyone!!!

I have an SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) analytic story where a story-level date filter (not an input control) is applied on a posting date dimension.

In this story, I have two tables:

  • Table 1 displays data for the currently selected date from the story filter.

  • Table 2 displays data for the same month of the previous year, which has already been achieved.

Now, I need to align this logic with dynamic text boxes placed above each table.

For Table 1, the requirement is straightforward. The dynamic text directly fetches the selected date from the story filter and displays it with a message, for example:
“Balance Sheet as on April, 25” (Month, YY)

For Table 2, I need a second dynamic text box that displays the same month but previous year, derived from the same story filter selection. For example:
“Balance Sheet as on April, 24”(Month, YY)

The key constraints are:

  • The date selection comes from a story filter, not an input control.

  • Dynamic text should be driven by the same story filter selection.

I would like to understand the recommended and supported approach in SAC to derive and display the previous year (same month) date in a dynamic text box, based on a story-level date filter.

Any guidance, best practices, or scripting-based solutions would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Hiding Blank Story Filter in SAC with BW Live Data
entry.content: I am using an SAP Analytics Cloud analytic model with BW Live data. I excluded one dimension member because the cost should not be accounted and set the filter option to hide, so no titles are shown. However, a blank filter is still visible in the story filter area. Is it possible to completely hide this story filter or handle it using some other method in SAC without modifying anything in BW?

entry.title: Speedometer Style Chart for Sudden Value Spike in SAC
entry.content: I am using an SAP Analytics Cloud analytic model with BW Live data. Is it possible to create a speedometer or gauge style chart that visually rises from 0 to 80 million when sales in August is 80 million, so that it creates a strong visual impact instead of directly showing the value?

entry.title: Geo Map Support with BW Live Data in SAC
entry.content: I am using an SAP Analytics Cloud analytic model with BW Live data. Is the geo map chart not supported for BW Live connections because it is not available in the chart list, or are there any specific limitations or prerequisites for using geo maps with BW Live data?

entry.title: Running total for a set of dimension in SAC Story on S/4 Hana Live Connection
entry.content:
MaterialWerkDateOrder NumberOrder QuantityTotal Quantity
32222AT4301.12.202522224040
32222AT4302.12.20252223242
32222AT4304.12.2025400050142
32222AT4304.12.2025500050142
32222AT4501.12.2025700011
32222AT4305.12.202550001143
32222AT4502.12.2025700023

I want to show running total for a combination of Material and WERK  in the column Total Quantity based on Order Quantity when ordered by Date in ascending Order. In the below example for 

1st record : 40 for total quantity

2nd record : 40+2 = 42 for total quantity

3rd record and 4th record  , there are 2 orders for same day and same combination , so the total Quantity will become 42 + 50 + 50 = 142 and will be shown in both rows of 3rd and 4th 

5th record , there is a different WERK , so it will have 1 for Total Quantity 

6th record , again same material and WERK combination , so the Order quantity will get added to 3rd/4th row value and show as 143 for Total Quantity

7th record again has same combination of Material and WERK , so the order Quantity will get added to Total Quantity value of 5th record and show as 3 as Total Quantity in 7th record.

entry.title: SAC - API retrieve attachments
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I would like to access attachments of specific documents directly from archive link, instead of having to display posting first in Fiori app and then retrieve the attachments which was available in S4 Content repository server
SAC should be able to call archive links of documents via API, when clicking on a document number in SAC. The link should take you directly to the attachment of a document. Same API used for creating attachments in S4 can be used for retrieving attachments. Need to present the read content on the screen in pdf or other format Also need to come up with logic to formulate the URL to open the correct document.
While proceeding with further for connection creation. we need direct connection to SAC to content repository server can we achieve it.
Any KBA related we need direct connection to SAC to content repository server they need how this can be setup. available.
Need details about does this API URL will helps to connect for Content repository server or open text. Can you help us how can we proceed further

we are thinking to follow the Multi action presented in the SAC and apply the API URL there and bring the multi action into the story and run the multi action but the user doesn't want to run any multi action when there click on the document number it was open pdf of the data related to that document which is present in the content repository. Can anyone suggest the exact approach for this question we are looking for any KBA related to how to set up Connection and for API URL.

entry.title: How to Add Dynamic Text to Chart Based on Input Control Selection
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I'd like to add dynamic text to a chart in SAP Analytics Cloud. The text should display "k" when I select "MTD" in the input control, and "m" for "YTD" in the input control.

I know it’s possible to link the dynamic text to the input control’s displayed description or ID, but what I actually need is to customize the dynamic text content based on specific input control selections.

Does anyone know how to configure this?

Thank you in advance!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: SAC - Linked Analysis with activated compact display doesn't work
entry.content:
I’m using a table with the compact display enabled and attempted to activate Linked Analysis. However, when I try to use the table as a filter widget, nothing happens—the filtering doesn’t work.
Has anyone experienced a similar issue?
Many thanks

entry.title: Check Box vs. Switch
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have a general question regarding when to use a Check Box versus a Switch. According to the Fiori guidelines:

Don’t use a switch if: It’s unclear whether the control represents a state or an action. In such cases, use a checkbox instead.

The scenario I’m dealing with is a Settings panel that contains multiple options users can turn on or off. For certain settings (e.g., Translation, Loading Indicator), enabling the option immediately displays additional content in the UI. In these cases, I believe a Switch is appropriate because the change has an instant impact on the interface.

However, for other settings, enabling them does not produce any immediate UI change; the effect only becomes visible when the user navigates to another module. This raises the question:

Should we use a mix of Checkboxes and Switches based on behavior, or is there a way to unify the design by using a single control type to keep the UI consistent and clean?

Attached is the screenshot of the mockup that I'm currently working on. You can download to review. Thank you!

entry.title: No error notifications received when email publication in SAC was sent to nonexisting email address
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

When I use the SAC Publication function to send an email to an external non-SAC user with an invalid email address, SAC does not appear to throw an error. However, this means we, as the senders, have no way of knowing that the email was not actually delivered to the recipient.

 

Since colleagues in our company may leave from time to time, their former corporate email addresses will be deactivated. If we fail to promptly update their personal email addresses in SAC, these ex-colleagues will not receive the emails—and we, as the senders, will remain unaware of this issue.
 
Could you please advise if there is any effective solution to this problem?
 
My tests in the SAC system show that even when an invalid email address is used, the publication job will still be marked as successful without any error prompts.
 
I also have a similar question: if the recipient is an existing SAC user but their email address has been changed (rendering the old one invalid), will we still not receive a delivery failure notification when sending publication emails to their old, non-existent email address?
 
Thank you in advance!
 
SAP Analytics Cloud
